title: Top 5 E3 Games We've Played (So Far) - Kinda Funny Reacts
description:
Greg played more than 30 games at E3 Judges Week. Here are the five he loved. 

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

transcript_chunks.text: What's up everybody, I'm Greg Miller, and I want to talk to you about my five favorite games from E3. Now you might say, Greg, E3 hasn't really started yet; how did you see any games? Well, I went down to E3 Judges Week a while back and saw more than 30 E3 games ahead of the show, and like I said, these are the ones that wowed me. Okay, let's start with an easy one, Sonic Mania. Yeah, yeah, yeah, I know, I know; Tim has been talking about this one for a while, but this was my first time playing a bunch of the levels back to back to back. Man, did it take me back to playing Sonic 1 and two on my Sega Genesis running through Chemical Plant Zone with Tails by my side - it was joyous, colorful, and most importantly fun. I'm not a high-score guy, but seeing all the alternate paths definitely had me thinking about doubling back for different runs. And the best thing about Sonic Mania is... I can't tell you it sucks, but one of the levels ended in a way that made the Sega fanboy in me grin from ear to ear, and it only made me more

for different runs and the best thing about Sonic Mania I can't tell you it sucks but one of the levels ended in a way that made the Sega fanboy in me grin from ear to ear and it only made me more excited about the secrets and fan service this game holds Sonic Mania is coming to everything August 15th next up let's get into VR that's right VR is dead and when I took a bunch of demos at Oculus I fell in love with Lone Echo's multiplayer mode Echo Arena think of Echo Arena as 4v4 Ultimate Frisbee in zero g but with punching strapping on a headset grabbing those fancy controllers and trying to throw a disc through a goal it was mesmerizing before I played Ready at Dawn made a big deal about how they animated hands reaching out to grab walls and I thought it was odd once I put out my hand to stop my glide and push off a surface it all made sense trying to pass the disc to a friend or climb up an opponent to stop them from scoring feels right plus you have rockets on your wrist makes

to stop my glide and push off a surface it all made sense trying to pass the disc to a friend or climb up an opponent to stop them from scoring feels right plus you have rockets on your wrist makes you feel like Iron Man as you fly around it's awesome and there's no release date at the moment now I want to tell you about A Hat in Time if a person tells you that their game is like a classic game you know they've either got something special or are lying through their teeth when a hat and time guy told me his game was like Mario 64 I wasn't sure what to think but after tackling the lengthy demo I am stoked collecting hour glasses grabbing yarn to make new hats and then using the special ability of those hats to reach new places yeah it's Mario 64 light controls and visuals mixed with Metroidvania elements it's cute it's funny and I'm interested to know more it's supposedly coming out in the second half of 2017 on PC Mac and Linux so stay tuned the second VR standout on this list is

Vania elements it's cute it's funny and I'm interested to know more it's supposedly coming out in the second half of 2017 on PC Mac and Linux so stay tuned the second VR standout on this list is LUNA, want me to sell it in a sentence it's a chill VR experience from a studio founded by two of the minds behind Journey phenomena describes Luna as a tactile VR puzzle game where players are encouraged to observe listen customize and interact but I think it's easier to say you're stepping into a work of art it's beautiful soothing and telling a fairy tale set in San Francisco but not the city parts of SF it's the parks and the natural stuff I never go to basically it's a relaxation Oasis in a headset and who doesn't need one of those it'll be out this fall and my favorite game of E3 so far The Last Day of June listen you know me and you know the games I like do you like the kind of games I like not the infamous and Uncharted games like do you like the story driven based games that are all

last day of June listen you know me and you know the games I like do you like the kind of games I like not the infamous and Uncharted games like do you like the story driven based games that are all artsy and try to make you cry yes then don't look into any more information about the last day of June just know it's our kind of game from the guy who did Murasaki baby and play it with no other knowledge when it comes out still need to be sold this game is trying a Tim Burton-esque art style it tells a heart-wrenching story without any words and there's time traveled to save the woman you love this game is too Greg Miller and although I've only played the opening I'm so in it'll be out this year on PlayStation 4 and PC and those are the five games I've seen at E3 before e3s even began what you think of my picks let me know in the comments below and make sure you click that subscribe button so you don't miss any of the E3 coverage we're putting up here on youtube.com kind of funny games

you think of my picks let me know in the comments below and make sure you click that subscribe button so you don't miss any of the E3 coverage we're putting up here on youtube.com kinda funny games all week because we are putting up a lot of stuff like we're doing a bunch of stuff on Twitch but then putting a whole lot more up here so you need to stay here and subscribe and like everything until next time it's been my pleasure to serve you
